content.title: You need to change your application
content.reason: You must have lived apart from your {{ divorceWho }}  for the past {{ limitYears }}  years to use this reason for divorce.
content.allowed: You are allowed to have spent some time living together, but only for up to 6 months (over one or more periods) and this time doesn’t count towards the {{ limitYears }} year separation period. You’ll need to have lived apart for longer to make up any time that you spent living together.
content.proceed: If you want to proceed with your divorce application, you must choose another fact which applies to you or wait until you have been separated for long enough.

question.text: Have you lived together for more than
question.yearsAndMonths: years and 6 months in the past. If you have lived together for more than 6 months (over one or more periods) since that date, then you can't use this reason for divorce at this time.
question.livedMore: If you have lived together for more than
question.needNotToUse: you won’t have been separated for long enough to use the {{ limitYears }} years separation reason for divorce at this time.
